column4: Operational emissions do not harm people or the environment
To reach a sustainable future, every company must eliminate all harmful solid, liquid and gas emissions from its operations.

An emission is deemed harmful if it: has properties that make it dangerous to human health or the environment; is designated as harmful by a credible industry body, country legislation or peer-reviewed research; or does not break down in nature.
